Row.Text: "But he has nothing on at all," cried at last the whole people. That made a deep impression upon the emperor, for it seemed to him that they were right; but he thought to himself, "Now I must bear up to the end." And the chamberlains walked with still greater dignity, as if they carried the train which did not exist.
"Treachory and violence are spears pointed at both ends - they wound those who resort to them worse than their enemies."
"I give you the mausoleum of all hope and desire."
